page.title: 18Battle of Camperdown (2)
page.content: On the 17th of October 1797 Admiral Duncan was created Viscount Duncan of Camperdown and Baron Duncan of Lundie. He received the thanks of both Houses of Parliament for his great victory against the Dutch and a pension of Â£2,000 per annum from the Crown.Early in 1798 Lord Duncan visited Dundee and was received with great honour. A portrait was painted and placed in the town hall of Dundee. The name of the estate was changed from Lundie to Camperdown to commemorate the great victory. The estate continued in the hands of the Duncan family into the 20th Century until in 1947, it having been presented to the town, the estate was opened as a public park by Her Royal Highness Princess Elizabeth, who became our Queen in 1953.
